value: Medium: linen, wool Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1972: Clara Waldeck collection; 1972: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Two lengths of linen with an inset border at one end of embroidered knotted netting. Embroidery is a repeating floral unit based on square guard bands of pulled work. Fringed gauze woven band at very end.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: needlework on knotted net

label: Description
value: Arabic inscription embroidered in red silk on a natural linen ground. Translation: Bismillah ir-Rahman – In the name of God the Merciful.

value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Gold diamond lattice containing blossom on red background

value: Medium: silk, metal wrapped silk Technique: satin woven with supplementary wefts

label: Description
value: Tiraz fragment of natural linen with three tapestry bands. Two outer bands have a repeat of medallions containing alternately a bird and a rabbit; above and below is Islamic inscription. The central band has a repeating ogee shape with scrolls containing two confronted birds.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: plain weave, slit tapestry with eccentric weft, doublesided

label: Description
value: Square repeat of a branch with curving leaves and large blossoms [one red, one blue] growing out of a shell-shaped mound.  The background is brown.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: warp-faced plain weave foundation with discontinuous supplementary wefts bound on the front in 3/1 twill and free-floating on the back.

label: Description
value: Figural group showing the crowning of Mars.

label: Provenance
value: Rodman A. Heeren; 1972: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Bold foliate design, possibly palm fronds.

label: Description
value: Fans of ostrich plumes emerging behind sunburst of jewels, over which are drapery swags rendered in flock; this bound by a string of pearls and emeralds. Swags are caught up with jewelled medallion from which is pendant a giant pearl, and over this, a cluster of jewels. Tassels hang below this. Along the edge, egg and dart banding.  On the verso, an imprint of a simple striped pattern with sprigs in widely-spaced grid, the paper hung with this frieze.

label: Provenance
value: From the early 1800s to the mid-1970s this paper hung in the parlor at Locust Thicket in Lynchburg, Virginia. See object file for information on the house.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh B. Jackson

label: Notes
value: Fans of ostrich plumes emerging behind sunburst of jewels, over which are drapery swags rendered in flock; this bound by a string of pearls and emeralds. Swags are caught up with jewelled medallion from which is pendant a giant pearl, and over this, a cluster of jewels. Tassels hang below this. Along the edge, egg and dart banding. On the verso, an imprint of a simple striped pattern with sprigs in widely-spaced grid, the paper hung with this frieze.

label: Description
value: Large-scale pink and white poppy flowers printed on top half of brown "oatmeal" or "ingrain" paper.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles R. Gracie & Sons, Inc.

label: Description
value: Tile pattern, with large stylized floral ornaments alternating with small floral arrangements, printed in tan on gray ground, on embossed paper simulating textile weave.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles R. Gracie & Sons, Inc.

label: Description
value: Dark rust-colored flocked stripes, increasing and decreasing in width to simulate fluted column, alternating with narrow beige stripes, overprinted with floral scrolling motif. Large band of flocked area running along one side.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles R. Gracie & Sons, Inc.

label: Description
value: Central field enclosed within a four-part border. Field is a black ogee lattice with a multicolored vine enclosing lobed red medallions with multicolor symmetrical floral pattern. Main border has a curving vine with large blossoms, leaves and birds in an Indian style on a greenish-tan background. Inner guard stripe, multicolored floral vine on a grey-green background. Outer guard stripe, stemmed triangles on a brown background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, silk Technique: chain (with a hook), satin, seed and couching stitches on patchwork and applique of felted or fulled fabrics

label: Description
value: Blue and white diamond diaper with simplified flowers.
Sketch of Floor Plan Facing a Lake, for Stage Set

label: Description
value: Plan of house with rooms identified; lake upper margin.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of University of California, Los Angeles

label: Description
value: Appears to be a floral bouquet in a basket. Printed in colors on a light tan ground.

label: Description
value: Scalloped edge at bottom.  Appears to be a ribbon and foliate twist. Printed in burgundy, pink, yellow ocher, black and tan.

label: Description
value: Scrolling foliage and floral design. Printed in brown and tan.

label: Description
value: Aesthetic or Anglo-Japanesque design. Band of deep red flowers across center. Olive-green foliage above. Band of quatrefoils below. Printed in deep red, olive-green and tan on burgundy ground.

label: Description
value: All-over pattern of fine lines simulating a textile weave. Printed in brown and red on tan ground.

label: Description
value: Mission-style design. All-over striae-type pattern with a cut-out border attached. Printed in shades ot brown and tan.

label: Description
value: Continuous stripe pattern in yellow, tan and red on red ground showing symmetrical leaf clusters and rosettes in the Empire style. Compound weave of two structures: 5-harness satin weave foundation with 3/1 twill pattern. The twist is interconnected with the foundation satin in plain weave. Floats of the foundation weft to pattern are bound in 3/1 twill, by the twill warp. Cut from a larger fabric to be used as a trimming band.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: satin weave, twill weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1973:  A. Hyatt Mayor collection; 1973: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: All-over pattern of large-scale leaves and flowers. Printed in greens and salmon on ochre ground.

label: Description
value: Faux or imitation marble pattern: a) printed in shades of brown; b) printed in shades of blue-green. Printed by the "Namalac Process".

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Aimée and Rosamond Lamb

label: Description
value:
Two alternating  landscape medallions enframed in symetric acanthus medallions. Trellis or fretwork and floral sprigs fill in the background. Printed in blue and white on a striped white ground. Printed in selvedge: "Birge  4428".

value: Gift of Aimée and Rosamond Lamb

value: Gift of Aimée and Rosamond Lamb

value: Realistically rendered wisteris in glossy light blue and lavender on light blue ground imitating moire silk. Printed on textured paper.

value: Sanitary paper depicting eight different landscape views, in tile format.  The landscapes are printed in color and alternate with rows of yellow bricks .

label: Description
value: Narrow border containing a continuous Greek key motif. Printed in tan, darker tan, burgundy flock and metallic gold. This object is in two pieces, joined on the verso by gummed glassine.

label: Description
value: Two borders of arched and scalloped design with floral motifs in brown, gold, and burgundy.

label: Provenance
value: Samuel J. Dornsife; 1973: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Vining foliage and flowers printed in red flock, against background of thin gold stripes on red, with a black band containing red bosses running the length of either selvedge.

label: Description
value: Quilt one side of which is large piece of early 19th century relief-printed fabric with an all-over pattern of small rosette in red on a yellow background in a half-drop repeat. The opposite face is a piecing of three painted fabric fragments : 1) 18th century intaglio print in red with large scale pattern of peacocks in a tree, still life with musical instruments, a scarf in the branch of a tree; 2) 18th century intaglio print with landscape scenes including a procession; 3) 18th century relief print in red with a domestic scene of children dancing and playing instruments with adults in a garden. Pieces of yellow 2/2 twill fabric used on the piece side as part of the border.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave; running stitches throuhg three layers

label: Description
value: All-over repeat of pastoral amorous scenes in red: lovers half reclining in wheat field (she holding a horn) surprised by a man holding a sickle; lovers seated next to a fountain mutually playing a flute; two women in a garden (one clutching the other) being watched by a man behind a huge urn; boy playing bagpipe among geese; cupid fishing for eels; woman writing in a garden watched by Cupid. Straight repeat.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

value: All-over pattern of regularly spaced roses of various sizes in reds, yellows, and greens on a deep maroon background. Half-drop repeat.
